text: Charles Leslie Stewart MM (12 July 1880 – 21 August 1957) was an Australian rules football player and World War I veteran. ==Football career== Stewart played three matches for Carlton during the 1901 VFL season. He had come to Carlton from Essendon District. ==War service== Stewart was a veteran of both Gallipoli and the Western Front. Rising to the rank of acting sergeant, he was awarded the Military Medal for bravery in March 1918. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1880 births Category:Carlton Football Club players Category:Australian rules footballers from Victoria (Australia) Category:Australian military personnel of World War I Category:Australian recipients of the Military Medal Category:1957 deaths
title: Charlie Stewart (footballer, born 1880)
